item.title: Agile: When is a story done?
item.description: I’ve worked on a few different agile projects and one of the things that hasn’t been completely consistent is when we consider a story to be 'done'. There seem to a few different approaches, each of which has its benefits and drawbacks. Why do we care? We care about 'done' for tracking the points we have achieved in an iteration and for knowing when we have added the value the story provides.
